p: The genetic diversity of HIV-1 is striking in Yunnan. In addition to the abovementioned subtypes and circulating recombinant forms (CRFs), a multitude of URFs were also detected in Yunnan [ 12, 17]. In the late 2000s, the proportion of URFs ranked second only to that of CRF08_BC in recent infections [ 12]. These URFs contributed to the formation of novel CRFs. In recent years, at least nine CRFs were identified in western Yunnan [ 18â€“ 25]. These CRFs consist of components from subtype B, subtype C and CRF01_AE. A respective phylogenetic study showed that some of these CRFs originated in the early 1990s [ 9].
